unit_learning_outcomes.description: Create meaningful intercultural encounters by applying very specific language conventions.
Develop highly sophisticated skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Russian language.
Demonstrate a highly sophisticated and nuanced awareness of language and language use, in both Russian and in English.
Describe, evaluate and analyse a wide range of complex aspects of Russian-speaking cultures and societies.
Evaluate and deploy a very broad range of grammatical structures of Russian.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and language practice. Students should be familiar with and feel comfortable with each week’s content before starting a new week. Seminar preparation time also includes time to study, revise tutorial content and prepare for the quizzes and tests.

assessments.description: The purpose of the written examination is to check students’ knowledge of all aspects of grammar and vocabulary that they learn throughout the semester. This will be a part of regular seminar time.
Students have to demonstrate their knowledge and engagement with material explained the during semester.

For the oral test, students have to prepare a three-minute talk on a topic of their choice. Students will be assessed on their presentation, as well as their ability to answer follow-up questions. This will be a part of regular seminar time. Online students will do this task via Zoom.
The purpose of the examination is to check students’ knowledge of all aspects of grammar and vocabulary that they learned throughout the semester.

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This is an advanced Russian unit. The aims of the unit are to extend written and spoken communicative proficiency as well as promote a more comprehensive and sophisticated knowledge of contemporary Russian. This unit includes practice in speaking, understanding, reading and writing Russian through the use of authentic Russian language materials.
data.title: A Russian Studies 8
